May install assembled body shape. May engage an assistant to hold structure on frames for having wooden support and guide him in manipulating it. parts fitted to it. description_desc: Textile) spins yarn from cotton or wool Spinner, Jute using ‘charkha' (spinning wheel). Loops small length of yarn around spindle of Spinner, Jute tends number of spindles on charkha, holds end of yarn length along spinning frame for converting jute sliver with sliver of cotton or wool in left hand, received from drawing frame into yarn. turns spinning wheel by right hand Arranges s liver cans at back or spinning simultaneously withdrawing left hand frame. description_desc: Electrician (Mines) Access Controls Installation Technician, is also called ‘Access Control Device Installer’. Kills or stuns animal and thrusts knife machine. Chops, minces and mixes into jugular vein to drain off blood; flays ingredients by machine as required. description_desc: Workers Sampling Tailor 7534 Upholsterers and Related Workers 7535 Pelt Dressers, Tanners and Sampling tailor is responsible for Fellmongers developing garment sample as per buyer’s 7536 Shoemakers and Related Workers specifications in the apparel industry. A sampling tailor should be able to perform Family 7531 basic fabric cutting operations and stitch Tailors, Dress Makers, Furriers and garments of various designs with different necklines, sleeves, collar etc. as per the Hatters quality standards. This job requires the individual to have thorough knowledge of Tailors, dressmakers, furriers and hatters measurements, garment styles, sampling fabricate, fit, alter and repair tailored or and apparel production processes and hand-made clothing; They produce made- should be able to sew garments with to-measure clothing such as suits, different materials and trims. overcoats, and dresses from textile fabrics, light leather, fur and other material, or make hats or wigs according Qualification Pack Details: to customer’s and clothing manufacturer’s QP NOS Reference AMH/A0701 specifications. description_desc: Waterproofer, Textile 8151.2200 Fetler (Woollen Textile) Waterproofer, Textile treats textiles with chemicals (other than rubber) to make Fetler (Woollen Textile) cleans rollers and them water resistant. Fills container with cylinders of carding machines to remove chemical solution (other than rubber) and wool waste. Removes, slides off, or controls its temperature. Feeds lengths of otherwise disconnects belts and chains material into rollers and joins ends that drive machine. Climbs on machine, together. Passes material through rollers slowly rotates rollers and cylinders by into solution until it is impregnated and hand picks out accumulated dirt, fibres removes folds and creases, if any. Cleans and foreign matter and assures that equipment and maintains them in working moving parts operate freely. Reconnects order. May combine dyeing process with drive mechanism. Attends to cards until waterproofing; chemicals used and cards get filled with material. Assists experience of controlling solution Condenser Minder in taking out ends and temperature; knowledge of combining putting them on proper position on dyeing process with waterproofing and if condenser bobbins. May attend to card also able to treat textiles with rubber. mounting and assist in repair work of cards. description_desc: Modeller, Pottery and Porcelain models Tube and Rod Drawer (Glass) pottery or porcelain ware, according to drawings, patterns, specifications or by Tube and Rod Drawer (Glass) draws glass creating own designs, for use in preparing into tubes and rods using solid iron rod or moulds. Examines drawings or blowpipe. Collects from Bubble Maker specifications; mixes plaster-of Paris or iron rod with molten glass heated to clay with water and kneads mixture to proper temperature at its end. Sticks required consistency and texture; beats molten glass on iron post held by Helper, mixture with small flat wooden piece to blows and transfers fibres of glass into rod make it plastic; makes models by carving of the Helper who walks with it; blows plaster or clay, by shaping material on a down tube to maintain air cavity to potter’s wheel or by other methods. May prepare tube of required thickness; work from given designs or create his own continues operation until tube or rod is designs. May specialize in modelling prepared. particular type of products such as toys, domestic or sanitary wares. description_desc: Assembly Operator-TV ISCO 08 Unit Group Details: Code 8212 TV Assembly Operator assembles various Title Electrical and Electronic parts of the television to produce the set. Equipment Assemblers Key parts may vary depending on the type of television being manufactured, e.g., 8212.1601 CRT, LCD, LED. The individual at work is Manual Insertion Operator responsible for fitting in the different modules of the television set into the Manual Insertion Operator inserts frame using appropriate screws and components on printed circuit board connectors during the different stages of (PCB) as per the design. The individual on the assembly process. The individual is the job is responsible for manually fixing expected to minimise errors at every different electronic components, stage since the assembly line is especially, in through-hole assembly of continuously in motion components that cannot be inserted using pick-and-place machine because of Qualification Pack Details: reasons such as inconsistent shape or size QP NOS Reference ELE/Q3502 or hand-soldering requirement.
